infotexts:
T.S.M The Teamwork Secrecy Mercyn Company has gradually evolved into a significant faction. With its wide-reaching influence and resources, the company's role has expanded beyond mere commercial operations, extending into the political and military realms of the deep-sea world, forming a powerful faction with a profound impact on deep-sea exploration and regional security. TSM is an outstanding multi-field enterprise. The company is renowned for its exceptional escort services, providing unparalleled safety guarantees, ensuring the safety of deep-sea explorers and merchant vessels. A new submarine is clearing threats from the waters of Europa. The Coalition has responded positively and hopes more teams will join in to make the channels safer. TSM has your back TSM's fortress city [previousname] has fallen. TSM's fortress city [previousname] has relocated to a more suitable location. TSM discovered the ecological zone [previousname] and established a fortress city there. TSM cleared the internal threats of [previousname] and established a city on this foundation.
“If you're not capable and not planning to pay the deposit, don't waste my precious nap time.” Thought better of it This passage has been sealed off by TSM. If you want to continue, your reputation with ‖color:faction.tsm‖ TSM must exceed [requiredreputation], and you must obtain the administrator's permission. You can view your current reputation in the info interface.

Current Reputation: [currentreputation] “You want to pass this checkpoint?”
The administrator looked up, his gaze sweeping through the fleet via the control panel's light screen, then skillfully operating the terminal,
“Wait a moment, I need to verify your fleet's records.”
A few seconds later
“Welcome, Captain. After review, your reputation is sufficient. Permission to travel to the Europan Ridge has been granted. The authorization has been synced to your terminal.”
He paused, a hint of seriousness flashing in his eyes
“But, the Europan Ridge is far more perilous than previous routes. Deep-sea currents, unknown creatures, and wrecked ships may threaten your safety at any moment. Captain, please stay calm and cautious.” “You want to dive into deeper waters?”
The administrator smiled faintly, lightly touching the terminal, “Hold on a moment, I need to pull up your records.”
A few seconds later, the data on the screen made the administrator frown, “Sorry, according to the current records, you haven't met the requirements to pass the blockade.”
“But...” he paused, glancing from the terminal to you, with a slightly playful tone, “This is T.S.M, after all. In these waters, there are always exceptions. If you insist on heading deeper, we can make an exception—provided you pay a 2000mk deposit.”
The administrator leaned back in his chair, his gaze filled with a mix of anticipation and calculation, “Now, the decision is yours. What will you choose?” 2000MK, deal! “Great! I like people with this kind of attitude. I'll let the folks at the blockade know; you just go ahead.” “No money? Well, then I can't help you. Your fleet's records don't look too promising. If you're broke, consider earning some cash through bounties.” “If you're not capable and not planning to pay the deposit, don't waste my precious rest time.” “You want to head to the Aphotic Plateau?”
“Please hold on a second,” the administrator's fingers swiftly glided over the terminal.
A moment later, the administrator smiled in satisfaction, “It seems you've been contributing a lot to the Ice Ridge. I'm pleased to announce—you now have access to the Aphotic Plateau.”
“May you sail smoothly in those dark depths. Safe travels, Captain.” “You want to enter the Aphotic Plateau?”
The administrator squinted, lightly tapping the terminal, and chuckled softly after a moment, “Judging by the records, this doesn't look too promising…” “I understand, I understand, is 4500mk enough?” “Your records aren't bad, but are you truly ready? This dangerous sea won't accept just anyone.” “Not enough money, huh? Well, we've recently posted some bounty missions, why not give them a shot?” “Whether you go or not, that's not for us to decide, it's up to you. After all, the Europa Ridge is a great place to live, isn't it?” “Ah, it's you! You're the star fleet everyone's been talking about, right? Your tales are all over Europa.”
“Of course, of course, this means you've earned the right to traverse the Aphotic Plateau. You may now set sail for the Great Sea. Not many fleets have managed to make it there under the current circumstances.”
The administrator stood up and shook your hand, “I'll notify the checkpoint ahead to allow your passage into the Abyss. May you proceed safely through those unfathomable waters.” “My apologies,”
The administrator sighed, a hint of helplessness in his expression, “I know it hasn't been easy for you to make it this far, you've overcome many obstacles. But we cannot risk letting an unqualified fleet venture into the Great Sea.”
He looked up, his tone softening slightly, “This is for your protection. I hope you understand, not everyone can handle the dangers lurking there.” “What if we pay a 9K deposit?” “According to our regulations, you can indeed pass,” he said slowly, his tone solemn.
“But I must advise you to think carefully. The Great Sea is not a place to tread lightly.” He gazed at you, his voice low and full of meaning.
“That sea holds endless unknowns and dangers, and not everyone returns from it. Please consider carefully.” “If you don't have enough money, don't push it. Besides, money isn't everything—stay alive first, then talk.” “As I said, there's no need to go overboard. The Aphotic Plateau are great, livable, and TSM's headquarters are there. Why not buy an apartment and retire?” The administrator saw you from afar and stood up, shaking your hand. “Look who it is! The famous star fleet! What can I do for you this time?”
Upon hearing your request to travel to the Hydrothermal Wastes, the administrator's expression stiffened slightly. He was silent for a moment, then spoke in a slow, deliberate tone: “The number of creatures in the next area is abnormally high, and the currents stirred by geothermal activity will make navigation even more dangerous.” He looked at you, as if gauging your resolve. “Are you truly prepared?”
He straightened up and saluted you. “Then, please be careful—do not be careless.” “So you want to enter the Hydrothermal Wasteland? Many fleets have tried, and many have gone missing. This is T.S.M's deposit system. If you're determined to go, take a look.” “17000mk? No problem, I'll transfer the money shortly.” “Don't rush. You can always reconsider. It's rare to see someone who's both earning money with their life and buying their way into danger. First time I've seen someone paying to die.” “Then don't go. You need both money and life to enjoy it. As long as you're alive, you'll always have money.” “Many could've stood where you are now, with the courage to press forward.”
Hey, dude, welcome to our outpost. We've been having some trouble lately, can I ask you a favor? Though he wears a clown mask, his flamboyant attire allows you to instantly recognize him as a bishop wanted by both the Coalition and TSM. Looking around, you decided to listen to what kind of favor he's going to ask. I was heading to the next outpost, but the channel is blocked by T.S.M right now. I have something very important to do there, if... I mean, if you could help deal with them... It would depend on how sincere you'd like to be. Oh! My friend, I can be as sincere as you want me to be. You recognize him as a wanted man and handcuff him. "You asshole, do you know where you are! This is not the territory of your The Seditionists of Mendacity! Somebody, somebody!" The bishop yells over, and everyone around you leans toward you with all kinds of weapons. You have a bad feeling and are about to flee when an explosion goes off and the Coalition Riot Suppression Force invades from all over the place. While you're still in a daze, you hear from a walkie-talkie, "Empty the room, leave no one alive!" Ignore him and leave. Getting the job done

While you were strolling leisurely, a person dressed as an alliance soldier called out to you from behind Are you calling me? What's the matter? We need to take your ship to the next station. If you can take us, we can pay you 5000 mk Well... I need to ask my crew. If it's possible, we will call you when we leave the port No problem, we will wait for your news
Hello there, friend Yes, yes! Have you heard of the Dementonite Space? Whether you know me doesn’t matter, but I know you. How about you chat with me for a bit? An old man like me just craves some company every now and then. You’re partially right. It has no fixed physical coordinates and cannot be reached through conventional means. From a dimensional science perspective, the Dementonite Space is a "Consciousness Dimension" parallel to the material universe, yet it also has a physical aspect. Take the containers we use, for example—many of them are made from Dementonite Wrench. They look small, but can hold far more than their size suggests. That’s because the ore’s unique properties transfer those objects into that very dimension. Do you think we could ever enter the Dementonite Space? Nothing is absolute. It has no fixed coordinates, but we can create anchors. Of course, the most crucial step to get in is to have a "Gate". Exactly. With a Gate, not only can we enter that dimension—we can even drag an entire area into it. There’s so much more to say about all this. Time’s running out, I’m afraid I have to go now. Thank you for chatting with me for so long, friend. I can’t let you waste your time for nothing—here, take this crate as a gift. Names don’t matter, but you can call me Doctors. Did you call me? Wait, hold on—don’t talk about the Dementonite Space yet. Do I even know you? Fine, fine. The Dementonite Space... I’ve only ever heard of it. Isn’t it some kind of place that doesn’t exist in our timeline, or even our dimension? So that’s how it works. That’s impossible, isn’t it? You just said it has no physical coordinates and can’t be reached. A Gate? That sounds terrifying. Like, you could be asleep one second, then wake up in a whole different world.So what is this Gate, anyway? Do we have to find it, or can we build it ourselves? Oh right, I still don’t know your name. What a strange old man.
A broadcast blares from the communicator. "Calling all crew members of the newly docked vessel. Please proceed to the main office—your attendance is required at a meeting."
As you step into the conference room, you spot several personnel standing by, reviewing their respective communication panels. Catching sight of you, the controller immediately reports into their panel: "Chairman, all attendees have arrived." "Very well, noted. Make this quick—first, report on the current situation in Sector 54." "Greetings, Chairman Zhang and esteemed colleagues. I am the administrator of Sector 54. Recently, abnormal activity has been detected within the Potent Plague Eliminator-infected zones of our sector, and an unknown signal source resembling a 'Beacon' was identified at the epicenter of the infection. Needless to say, the threat posed by such a Beacon speaks for itself." "A 'Beacon' is the core of a Broodmother, the critical node where Potent Plague Eliminator entities converge and form. It emits a 'broadcast' signal that accelerates the Potent Plague Eliminator's mutation process while enabling control over infected organisms—these are the key details we have ascertained thus far." Pausing briefly, he continues his report: "Currently, the infected area in Sector 54 is expanding relentlessly, posing a direct threat to our sector's pharmaceutical and ammunition production facilities. As a result, worker panic has spread, leading to mass resignations. If this trend persists, it will trigger a crisis of supply disruption for related materials; in the worst-case scenario, the infected zone may expand to cover 50% of the entire sector." "Can we restart production lines in Sector 33?" "Greetings, Chairman Zhang. Sector 33 is located adjacent to the war zone between the Alliance and the Rebels, making raw material transportation extremely high-risk. Furthermore, all equipment in the sector is outdated, and its production capacity is completely unable to meet our requirements. Restarting operations is not feasible at this time." "In that case, it seems we cannot afford to abandon Sector 54. Is Lin Ye present? As the earliest sector to be contained and managed, does Sector 73 have any viable solutions to offer?" "Greetings, Chairman Zhang. The situation in Sector 73 is fundamentally different from that of Sector 54—we completed the construction of our 'Isolation Gate' defense system years ago, and our Potent Plague Eliminator-infected zones have been in a frozen state long-term. Regular clearance of peripheral nests is sufficient to effectively contain Potent Plague Eliminator expansion and ensure the operation of frontline bases." He then shifts his tone: "That said, I have a proposal—would it be possible to deploy Gravity Throwers to carry out long-range strikes?" "That plan is not viable. We cannot safely deploy a Gravity Thrower strike team to an effective combat position. Additionally, Team Two 'White Hoof Crow' is on standby at headquarters, while Teams One and Three are both on active missions—no support can be redeployed in the short term." Everyone turns toward the sound of the voice as a man pushes open the door and enters. "Lei Sefen, you're late." "I wasn't exactly invited to this meeting, was I? Setting that aside—I'm here to present a plan. The follow-up experiments at San ShenQiu have been a resounding success; we now have seven qualified operators. As for 'Sea Conqueror', we currently have five units in our possession. If the board approves, I can immediately begin deployment preparations." "So this experiment has finally borne fruit after all. How controllable are the personnel? What degree of certainty do you have in resolving the crisis in Sector 54?" "Chairman Zhang, the controllability rate is approximately 70%. If executed according to plan, I have 100% confidence in resolving the issue." His gaze lands on you as he steps forward slowly, offering a hand: "Greetings. I am Lei Sefen from headquarters. I don't believe we've met before. Still, the fact that a non-staff personnel is allowed to attend this core meeting speaks volumes about your capabilities." Lei Sefen lets out a faint chuckle: "In the current climate, 'luck' alone hardly cuts it. Since you're willing to contribute to TSM, you're one of us. If you ever need assistance in the future, don't hesitate to contact me." With that, he turns and exits the room.
Continue You cut in abruptly: "Excuse me, but could someone please explain exactly what a 'Beacon' is?" You open your mouth to add further clarification, but a voice suddenly interrupts the proceedings: "I have a suggestion." Just got lucky with handling a few tricky situations—that's all. Nothing worth mentioning.
Come back later.

You see a man sneaking around, so you go up to see what he's up to. Ignore him and walk away. What are you doing?” You're putting your hand on his shoulder as you talk. “Don't run!” You hadn't taken two steps in pursuit when the station began to sound an alarm T.S.M:
 has detected an invasion by unknown forces and has now activated the T-71 defense protocols, with the entire site in lockdown. All citizens are requested to remain calm and proceed immediately to the nearest safe haven. The Sunset Combat Department will be launching a full-scale cleanup operation against the invaders, so please refrain from acting without authorization and wait patiently for the situation to recover.
You feel extraordinarily hot outside the submarine, and before long you're sweating profusely, reaching out to touch the outer shell only to be scalded and retract your hand...looks like there's something out there that's making the water boil?

TSM Freight Crate Large capacity, multi-purpose, fireproof and waterproof, reliable quality. TSM Toolbox Large capacity briefcase, made from exotic materials, with free after-sales service available. Weapon Case Features 9 slots, which can be used to store weapons, ammunition, or diving suits, and can also be worn on the back. Concert Tactical Backpack A tactical backpack with moderate capacity. Backpack A multi-purpose small-capacity backpack, easy to make but with limited space. Tactical Backpack Can hold a large amount of ammunition and a heavy weapon, effectively enhancing a soldier's sustained combat capability. Heavy Load Backpack A large bag that can hold many items and attach a toolbox and a heavy gun. It will slightly affect the use of weapons and submarine driving. Large Transport Backpack An even larger backpack that can hold two toolboxes and two heavy guns. However, its large size makes it inconvenient to use weapons and drive submarines when worn. Coalition Special Operations Backpack A type of backpack issued only to elite members of some special forces within the Coalition. It has moderate capacity but features two dedicated slots for diving suits and a specific attachment point for heavy weapons. However, its large size will affect weapon use. Special Operations Backpack Has moderate capacity with a dedicated space for diving suits. Its large size will affect weapon use. Large Special Operations Backpack A larger-capacity backpack with a dedicated space for diving suits. However, it is inconvenient to use tools for submarine maintenance when worn. TSM Anomaly Containment Box Container specialized for anomalous objects. All-Purpose Cart Made of tough plastic, it can carry a lot and won’t rust in seawater. When not in use, just stick it to the wall so it won’t slide around. Pop in a battery and it turns into a little lamp. The sub’s supply crew loves it. Don’t sit on it—if you do and get hurt, that’s on you. Trash Can Drop the junk you hate—like that stupid clown horn—inside, slam the lid, and forget it. Letting go is the only way to move on.

Crystallography Tempered from the streaming light of the deep sea into sharp crystal edges; cyan mist and abyssal blue twist into its grain, while starlit iridescence wraps the faint light of dawn and dusk. To touch it is like holding the sea within mist—hidden in its icy texture is the heartbeat of the tides. Hengberley Star Indigo overlaps with dark emerald veins; the crystal surface ripples with the cold rainbow unique to the abyss. The algal traces tangled at its base are the silent palm lines of the deep sea. A brush of the fingertip feels like touching the tide floor unthawed for millennia—trapped in its frigid crystal core is the lingering echo of slumbering ocean currents.

This kind of medical kit is not expensive, and it is non-refundable and non-exchangeable once sold. This kind of medical kit is expensive, but it is worth the price. Enhanced injection When used in conjunction with the Operator Assistance System, it can enhance a person's combat capabilities.

Suecide Vest Spreading fear to the world, a 10-second countdown begins once you put it on and activate it. Chest rig Perhaps it was those soldiers who loved to carry a lot of ammunition that couldn't take it anymore. This chest rig appeared on Europa. In exchange for reduced protection, it offers more carrying pouches to hold more items. Frontline Medic's Bulletproof Vest The white bulletproof vest is equipped with numerous carrying pouches for storing medical supplies. These details clearly signal to everyone around that the wearer is a skilled medic. If someone gets injured, they know exactly who to turn to. General bulletproof vest An ordinary bulletproof vest with basic ballistic protection and two carrying pouches. PMC Combat Uniform As quasi-military personnel, the mercenaries have to purchase their own kit from civilian markets and the black market. The resulting patchwork rigs may not be as solid as issued gear, yet, a lot more comfortable than a government tender. PMC lightweight bulletproof chest-rig Even if they’re only quasi-military, the mercs know exactly what the job needs. A cottage industry has come up to serve them, so they can piece together a bulletproof chest-rig with military protection level, along with a standardized pouches on it. PMC Combat Uniform This is a full of street fashion sense. The hooded jacket on the upper body is simple yet stylish, and the side stripes add a dynamic touch to the whole. It's suitable for activities in urban neighborhoods, being both comfortable and able to show one's personality. The casual pants with patterns are full of fashion elements, and the loose version allows for unrestricted movement. The classic sneakers balance fashion and practicality, and can provide good foot support and a comfortable experience for characters who shuttle in the city and perform special tasks. It's an excellent choice for wandering in the city and highlighting a unique style. PMC Combat Uniform It features a camouflage combat uniform, matched with protective gears like shoulder pads and arm guards. There is a tactical pouch on the waist. The overall appearance is full of a combat vibe, suitable for carrying out missions in complex environments. Boonie Hat It adopts a suitable light brown color and a wide-brimmed bucket hat design, which can effectively block the sun. Although there is no sun under the ice layer of Europa, making the sun-shading practical function unavailable, its unique color and style add a different sense of fashion to the cold Europa scene. It focuses on appearance and is a good choice for those who pursue a stylish look. Reaper Tactical Hood Overall, it is mainly in dark colors and decorated with skull elements, full of a sense of mystery and deterrence. It integrates tactical goggles to assist observation and also has a communication device for convenient instant contact. It seems like a messenger from the shadow of death, adding a strange combat aura to the user. Mercenary Communication Cap It is mainly khaki in color and equipped with professional communication headsets, which ensure information transmission in complex battlefield environments. The matching goggles and face shield balance communication and protection, making it a reliable piece of equipment for mercenary communication personnel. Mercenary Special Ops Protective Helmet It features black as its main color and is equipped with noise-canceling headphones, which can block out loud noises on the battlefield and help the wearer focus on key information. The red goggles have special optical effects, supporting observation in different light conditions, while the face shield protects the face. Together, they form a safe and efficient head protection system for mercenary special operations personnel.
Outpost Police Uniform A symbol of T.S.M's order, combining comfort with clear law enforcement visibility. Outpost Police Body Armor Designed exclusively for daily security patrols, it only provides basic protection against close-range low-caliber weapon fire and fragmentation damage. Its lightweight build is optimized for prolonged patrols and crowd control duties, rather than withstanding high-intensity combat. After all, the primary mission of station police officers is to maintain order, not to engage in battlefield confrontations. TSM Old-style Combat Uniform TSM Old-style combat uniform，Though it doesn't match the performance of the new combat uniforms from various departments, its affordability and durability still make it a favorite among most tacticians. TSM Old-style Bulletproof Vest It offers protection to more areas than a regular bulletproof vest, but its protective performance isn't particularly good. Advanced Combat Uniform Uniform of the Advanced Combat Division The "Sunset Mountain" Security Uniform A common combat suit in TSM station,mainly used by The "Sunset Mountain" combat division TSM Plate Insert Bulletproof Vest A bulletproof vest modified by "JiuZhou" Arsenal, with added plate slots that allow for the insertion of corresponding plates to protect against specific types of damage. TSM New-style Bulletproof Vest The bulletproof vest issued by TSM to cope with more complex environments offers enhanced protection without impeding the soldiers' mobility. It also features more tactical attachment points. Ming Fu Combat Uniform A combat uniform especially designed for the Ming Fu Squad, featuring lots of decorative elements and patterns that are both easy to work with and highly functional. It is amazingly durable, wear-resistant, and extremely comfortable. Hidden beneath the patterns are discreet pockets capable of holding several magazines or grenades. Ming Fu lightweight bulletproof chest-rig The Ming Fu squad's gear is rather distinctive: besides a lightweight bulletproof chest-rig that never hinders movement, each operator is issued additional arm and leg protections. That set allows any other units pick out the squad from every other T.S.M. unit at a single glance. Guard Corps Combat Uniform Helmet A dedicated slot for medical scanners is reserved;installing medical scanning accessories will activate the medical scanning interface. "JiuZhou" Combat Suit Suit for "JiuZhou" Combat Division.The uniform has been reinforced to better resist blunt force trauma and bites. It also features carrying pouches that can hold some equipment, and it provides a comfortable fit. "JiuZhou" Combat Helmet The Jiuzhou Combat Division Standard Helmet is based on an advanced combat helmet and has been modified to include a built-in night vision device that requires power to activate. Jiuzhou Combat Armor The Jiuzhou Combat Division Standard Armor is based on advanced combat armor and requires regular maintenance to ensure sufficient protective effectiveness. TSM Riotcontrol Helmet It can effectively prevent both civilian weapons and bladed weapons from harming the wearer's head. A large ballistic visor can be inserted to provide better protection. TSM Heavycombat Helmet The lining has been thickened to offer stronger resistance to impacts, and a large ballistic visor can be inserted for enhanced protection. TSM Heavy Gas Mask The matte black reinforced shell is embedded with a radiation-resistant coating, which can mitigate low-to-moderate intensity radiation exposure. Its lightweight frame also provides basic impact protection, making this helmet a common sight across various departments. TSM "NuJiang" Combat Helmet This is the exclusive helmet of the Station Assault Squadron. Its all-black shell aligns with the squadron’s assault operational positioning, and the external night-vision module is its core identifier—this device allows team members to accurately acquire targets in low-light environments. During pitch-black assault missions, the Station Assault Squadron serves as the key force to breach enemy defensive lines. Ming Fu Combat Helmet The helmet’s main frame is forged from matte black titanium alloy, with etched dark patterns on its surface serving as the identity mark for squad members. Its modular interfaces are compatible with a full spectrum of accessories—including thermal imagers, night-vision goggles, and medical panels—and can even connect to small protective face shields to enhance survivability in harsh environments. Redundant lightweight design has been discarded; instead, thickened lining and shock-absorbing modules balance protection and mobility. While slightly bulky in routine missions, this "Ming Fu Shell" can shield operatives from close-range shrapnel and stray rounds during high-intensity firefights.

Bird Nest Squadron Combat Uniform The exclusive combat uniform of the "Bird Nest" elite squadron affiliated with the Advanced Operations Department. Its unique blue-and-white striped camouflage serves as the key identifying feature. Designed to adapt to large-scale, high-intensity combat, the uniform integrates the characteristics of certain load-bearing equipment, with additional load-bearing pockets added to facilitate team members in storing magazines or emergency medical supplies. Bird Nest Squadron Plate Carrier The heavy full-coverage plate carrier used by the "Bird Nest" Squadron, specifically designed for large-scale, high-intensity combat. It is an indispensable piece of defense for the "Bird Nest" Squadron. While some argue that this plate carrier imposes significant restrictions on personnel mobility and performance in non-combat scenarios, such limitations are still acceptable compared to the protective performance it provides. Bird Nest Squadron Helmet Based on a heavy combat helmet design, it offers excellent protective performance for the wearer while featuring certain tactical expansion capabilities. It can be equipped with a thermal imaging chip to provide the wearer with tactical advantages. However, it has drawbacks such as vision obstruction, making it suitable only for special operations personnel who require head protection and have specific tactical needs in high-intensity combat. San ShenQiu Cape A dedicated cape for the San ShenQiu experimental team, specially designed to withstand certain amounts of damage and to resist damage caused by Triton rounds. It can activate an auxiliary system when paired with the San ShenQiu Combat Uniform and Helmet. San ShenQiu Combat Helmet A dedicated combat helmet for the San ShenQiu team, offering a certain level of defense and compatible with chips. It can activate an auxiliary system when paired with the combat uniform and cape. 'Feline' Advisor Bulletproof Vest Bulletproof plates made from alien minerals, offering higher protection without hindering the operators' mobility. 'Feline' Advisor Disguise Mask A mask issued for the advisory team's field missions, effectively concealing their identities. RongZhuang Prototype Due to various reasons and the increasingly severe situation, the TSM headquarters urgently needed a heavy fire support platform capable of entering the interior of a submarine. Thus, the prototype of the heavy fire support platform named "RongZhuang" was born. Gravitational Traction Protective Suit Effectively resists the gravitational suppression produced by anti-gravity traction laser beams and can dive up to a maximum depth of 7,000 meters. Military Advanced Protective Suit This military-grade protective suit, primarily equipped by the Advanced Combat Division in the TSM, can adapt to many harsh environments. When paired with magnetic shoes, it allows the wearer to maintain their posture under minor flood impacts and can dive up to a maximum depth of 6,000 meters. Orange Wraith Hazard Suit This hazard suit is exclusive to the Orange Wraith — as a full-scenario survival gear, its modular design covers core areas (torso, limbs, head) with corrosion-resistant, radiation-shielding composites, plus thermal insulation and cushioning layers. It fends off toxic gases, radioactive dust, and sustains life support in high-temperature/low-pressure extremes. A built-in self-injection slot adds an extra layer of safety in perilous environments, allowing quick access to emergency supplies (e.g. antidotes, stimulants) without exposing the wearer. Built on "single-suit multi-hazard compatibility", it handles industrial leaks, abandoned area infiltration, and low-intensity contaminated zone ops without modifications. The orange-red accents boost visibility while matching the Orange Wraith's signature insignia — a versatile, tactically distinct standard gear for high-risk environments. Maximum dive depth: 7,500 meters.Class I Exposure Protective Suit Modified from a military protective suit, the creator has incorporated advanced life and biological support technologies. Special fibers can effectively separate the wearer from harsh environments. The helmet is equipped with night vision, significantly enhancing its functionality. Specialized shoes can firmly grip the ground, reducing the impact of shocks, and it can dive up to a maximum depth of 7,500 meters. Riot Advancer Protective Suit As an assault-oriented heavy armor designed specifically for high-intensity conflicts, its core focus is on enhanced mobility and impact resistance: Fully constructed from high-toughness composite armor plates, it can withstand projectiles and blunt-force impacts in riot scenarios. Meanwhile, its lightweight frame allows the wearer to maintain an advancing rhythm even amid chaotic crowds, achieving the tactical goal of "forcibly pushing forward through riots." Its boots integrate small magnetic generators. When activated, they can adhere to surfaces on shallow water or slippery terrain, stabilizing the wearer’s center of gravity without compromising movement speed, allowing the user to sustain an assault posture even in complex environments. "Rongzhuang" Type 3A A heavy exoskeleton armor in full matte black, its bulky mecha-style structure wrapped in reinforced armor, with red patterns at the joints being the only bright visual accent in its stern appearance. Designed around the core of "firepower + protection", its outer alloy layer can withstand medium-to-heavy firepower impacts, while the built-in power module allows the wearer to easily carry heavy weapons — it is a tough piece of equipment in frontline assault missions that can act as both a "mobile bunker" and a "firepower turret". Coalition Bulletproof Vest A standard bulletproof vest with average performance, characterized by its minimal carrying pouches and design that does not restrict the soldier's movement. Coalition Elite Bulletproof Vest A bulletproof vest made from new materials, offering enhanced protective capabilities while maintaining the original design. Coalition Beowulf Bulletproof Vest Beowulf Body Armor Highlighted by its top-tier defensive performance, it integrates reinforced hard armor plates and shock-resistant fabric, providing reliable protection against close-to-medium range small arms fire and fragmentation threats. It delivers robust survivability for vital body regions in high-risk firefight scenarios. Yet its design trade-offs are distinct: to balance portability and tactical agility, the protective coverage is concentrated on the core torso area, with no shielding for limbs, neck, or other extremities. This armor is ideally suited for fast-paced assault and infiltration missions — sacrificing full-body coverage for the dual enhancement of core survival and tactical efficiency. Coalition Occupation Force Combat Uniform The built-in armor components of this combat uniform shield all vital body regions, striking a perfect balance between protection and tactical mobility. Coalition Stormy Seas Combat Uniform A common combat uniform in the Coalition. A practical standard-issue gear for station security teams.
Separatist Sharp Raider Combat Uniform A combat uniform made from new materials. Separatist Combat Uniform The standard combat uniform of the Separatists, made with sturdy materials and good quality. The sewn-on small pockets allow soldiers to carry personal items or ammunition. Requires fuel rods and a battery to operate.（no ai use） An anxious looking engineer stopped you./nHey！Was the submarine that just docked yours?？ I detected that T034 is active in the nearby waters. By coincidence, my submarine is under maintenance and can't move. Could you possibly help me out... Please let me explain... After the 034 experimental accident, T037 has regained its sanity and is still in a weakened state. It still has some kind of device left by Dr. Lin Han on its body. If we can investigate it further, I think humanity will soon be able to conquer it... I know sailors don't like these empty promises, but I've already prepared the reward, and I'll provide you with insulating diving suits. Plzzzz. That's right... He devoted his entire life to T037, tormenting himself in the process, and in the end, he was destroyed by it—both in life and in reputation. I just want to finish the journey he never completed. I will send the insulating tech diving suits to the submarine's cargo hold before you set off. Remember to throw some flares or other luminous objects to distract it. Although it is in a weakened state now, do not let your guard down. Defeat T034, remove the suspicious device from it, and I will be waiting for your good news at the next station. I salute you. Yes,what? You mean T037?! No way, that thing almost wiped out all of humanity on Europa before. There's no way we're going to commit suicide for you! Dr. Lin Han? Let me guess, you're his daughter, Lin Heyin? Alright... You scientists, though always making mistakes, are the ones we have to rely on to lead human civilization forward. What should I do? Congratulations! Did you manage to retrieve the suspicious device from T034? It's a pity... But as long as you're safe, that's what matters. Well done, everyone. He was just trying to communicate with T034 using a brain - computer interface, but an accident happened... Now there's an incredible hypothesis: Dr. Lin Han might still be alive. He accidentally uploaded part of his consciousness into T034's brain, but it's extremely unstable... How could a human possibly adapt to a giant beast's body? So both he and T034 are in great pain now. This is just a hypothesis I deduced using a theoretical model. If this brain - computer interface port system can still be repaired and the operational logs inside can be retrieved, all the problems will be solved effortlessly... You've done me a great favor, and I can also lend a hand to your submarine. Leave the electrical work to me! This is... the brain - computer interface port system, and it's actually been preserved! It lost consciousness and sank into the abyss, and it was too deep. Our submarine hasn't regained its power yet. I'm sorry we didn't retrieve the device you needed. Brain - computer interface? So the rumors are true? Dr. Lin Han connected his consciousness to T037 using a brain - computer interface, which caused T037 to go berserk and almost made the people of Europa regress to Crawlers. This is madness! You should report this to the Coalition and the T.S.M. If it goes berserk again, many more people will die! I got it! You don't have it with you? Then I'll wait here for you. Please go and get it.

Recorder Chris Evans A moment brighter than tears In the crowd, you spot someone very familiar. To confirm your guess, you run up and call out to him. "Have we met somewhere before?" As he turns around, your eyes immediately catch a grotesque and deep scar on his face—just as you suspected, he is indeed the former captain of the Beowulf Squad who was once wanted by the Coalition—Chris Evans. Despite his icy demeanor, there is still an imperceptible flicker in his eyes for a moment. His hand slowly reaches for his waist, as if the air would be ignited in the next second, suffocating. Your gazes intersect at this moment, the atmosphere suddenly solidifies, dropping to freezing point. "Hey! Don't be nervous," you raise your hands, palms out, slowly waving them, trying to break the tense atmosphere with a calm tone. Your movements are not large, for fear that any misstep would trigger an irreparable conflict. Chris stares at you, his hand resting on his waist, seemingly weighing the truth of your words. After a moment, he finally relaxes a bit, but still does not let his guard down completely. "Follow me," you whisper, nodding at him, then turn and walk towards a small passage. You lead him through several dim corridors until you reach a secluded corner—undisturbed by others and free from surveillance. "It's safe here. We can talk properly," you lean against the wall. "Abuse of power, violent private punishment, murder, disobedience of orders... all these charges are written under your name." Your voice is deep, each word piercing through the air and straight into his heart. "Now, when people on Europa talk about you, they talk about you as if you were the messenger of death. Seeing you, it seems that life will be taken away from them in the next second." Chris listens silently, lowering his head, taking out a crumpled cigarette from his pocket, slowly putting it to his lips, and lighting it with a lighter. The fire flickers in the dim corner, casting his face in an even darker shade. The deep scar looks particularly grotesque in the interplay of light and shadow, as if it were an indelible mark. He takes a deep drag, exhales slowly through his nostrils, enveloping himself in a cloud of smoke, carrying a heavy and cold sense of oppression. He raises his head, his gaze piercing through the smoke, looking straight at you, his eyes filled with a complex emotion, a mix of mockery and a silent warning. "Join me!" Your tone is firm. "Here, you will definitely be safe. The Coalition's wanted order, those hounds chasing you, cannot threaten you. Here, you can be free from being swallowed by their conspiracies and shackles." You take a small step forward, lowering your voice. "And it's not just protection—I can give you the chance to settle accounts with those evil people. Those who cause chaos and incite riots should not escape their deserved judgment!" When Chris hears the words "settle accounts with those evil people," a glimmer of light flashes in his originally indifferent eyes, as if igniting some long-buried emotion deep within him. He exhales a cloud of smoke, squints his eyes, and slowly speaks: "I don't care about the Coalition's wanted order. They've wanted to catch me for a long time." He pauses, his tone tinged with a hint of probing and disdain: "It's your mention of judgment that interests me a bit. But words are empty. Show something concrete. How do you prove that you have the strength to make me join?" "In this world, only those who are truly powerful have the right to talk about judgment and order. And you? What makes you qualified?" This is my proof (takes out the Beowulf Medal) How could you have it? I never care about the process, only the result Looks like you'll need to stock up on more lighters on your ship. Come on, Captain, let's start clearing out those guilty ones! If you can't prove your strength, don't bother me!

Perhaps it can be found in shipwrecks?—TSM ARS is a company that makes products with an automatic recording function, but behind the scenes, they are collecting various materials for trade or to strengthen their internal military forces—TSM There are reports that the Adventists are setting up "beacons" at various abandoned sites—TSM TSM originally started in the Source of the Lightless Sea—TSM The Coalition and the separatists are engaged in a war—TSM As the war intensifies, TSM's board of directors has announced that the income from the escort service project has exceeded other service projects for the first time and is considering increasing investment—TSM After a long period of construction, the Ice city project has finally been completed. It is reported that it will be opened to the public for residential and commercial services after all project inspections are successful—TSM DS104 border site has lost contact: TSM has dispatched relevant personnel to investigate—TSM TSM has three armed departments: the Advanced Combat Division, the Dusk Mountain Combat Division, and the Jiuzhou Combat Division. Their functions correspond to combat against humans, corporate security, and combat against monsters, respectively—TSM TSM is still just a company, but it also plays a key role in the development of Europa, urban construction, and technological research and development. Its subordinate departments cover almost all industries on Europa, such as military manufacturing, medical manufacturing, schools, and docks, and even have their own widow sites—TSM After the Adventists demonstrated the "miracle," their followers increased exponentially, including powerful individuals such as high-ranking officials from the Coalition—TSM The Adventists' mission is to bring their unique god to Europa, but the god's arrival requires a vessel. Currently, no living beings on Europa are suitable for this role, so their goal now is to create a perfect being—TSM The separatists are a more threatening and powerful group that has broken away from the separatist organization, intending to overthrow the Coalition's iron-fisted rule—TSM Communication has developed significantly, but there are still limitations—TSM Whether it is the Coalition, separatists, or TSM forces, they will call for reinforcements after encountering their first enemy. Be sure to be cautious.—TSM The Beowulf Squadron is the Coalition's most elite riot control and counter-terrorism unit. As the war continues to escalate, the responsibilities of this unit have far exceeded traditional riot control tasks and have been granted higher authority. Now, they are not only the pacifiers on the battlefield but also play the roles of judges, police, and executioners, becoming the Coalition's truly authoritative force that integrates trial and execution.—TSM The occupying forces are the Coalition's ace troops, known for their powerful heavy firepower, comprehensive support capabilities, and thick armor. They are the most formidable force on the conventional battlefield, showing overwhelming combat effectiveness in both offense and defense.—TSM EMBI, short for Europa Magic Biotechnology Company, mainly develops biological weapons—TSM Press Alt + F for quick activation of overhead shooting.
